messages.text: Hi David, I came across your recent interview in Supply Chain Tech Weekly — sounds like you're tackling some ambitious transformation goals. I'd love to learn more about how your team currently
Hi Bruce, Appreciate the note. We are indeed evaluating a few platforms as part of a broader overhaul. That said, we're still early — mostly internal discussions and mapping out requirements. I
Thanks, David — early is often the best time to get involved. Yes, we've worked with distributed teams in logistics and supply chain — UPS, DHL, and others. I'd be happy to tailor the
Tuesday 11 am works. Please send the invite. In the meantime, feel free to share any material that outlines how your CRM handles multiple business units. That's been a sticking point for us with

Calendar invite sent! Attaching a 1-pager that highlights how we segment permissions, reporting, and workflows across business units — particularly helpful for teams like yours that manage both B2B and
Thanks Bruce — got the doc. Some good points in there. Let's cover ease of integration on the Slack. That's another area where we've hit snags in the past. Looking forward to learning more.
messages.intent: acknowledge, raise new concern, express interest

summary: Bruce Wayne from GoatForce initiated contact with David Gonzalez at FedEx to discuss CRM solutions. David initially expressed they were in early stages but agreed to a meeting. David raised concerns about handling multiple business units and integration, which Bruce addressed by sending a relevant document. A meeting is scheduled to discuss these points further.
